statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: La Salle 90, Fordham 88 (OT)
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Darnell Harris scored seven of his 17 points in overtime to help La Salle to a 90-88 victory over Fordham on Sunday. Steven Smith led all scorers with 24 points and 12 rebounds and Jermaine Thomas added 23 for the Explorers (6-14, 2-7 Atlantic 10), who snapped a six-game losing streak. La Salle went 8-of-8 from the free throw line over the final 29 seconds to secure the victory. Marcus Stout and Jermaine Anderson each had 21 to lead Fordham (8-12, 4-5), which has lost 32 straight games in Philadelphia. Fordham's Sebastian Greene hit a short jumper to tie the game 71-71 with two seconds remaining in regulation and a 3-pointer by Anderson knotted the contest at 86-86 with 11 seconds left in overtime. Tabby Cunningham's two free throws with 9.7 seconds left gave La Salle an 88-86 advantage and Thomas stole the ball from Anderson on the ensuing possession and made two free throws to seal the win. Greene scored just before time expired for the final margin. Anderson and Corey McCrae each hit from 3-point range during a 10-0 run that tied the game with less than three minutes left in regulation, as the Rams battled back after trailing throughout most of the contest. The Explorers shot 53 percent from the field (17-of-32) in the opening half and led 44-38 at the break. With La Salle trailing 16-13 in the early going, Thomas hit a 3-pointer to tie the game. The basket sparked a 12-point run, capped by a 3-pointer by Harris, that gave La Salle a 25-16 lead with 12:22 remaining in the opening half.
